education.studyType: Engineering Cycle (Earned an Engineer's Diploma in AI)

work.name: SAFRAN Aerosystems
work.summary: Developed a web application to automate and manage the process of filling out and printing records for aircraft mechanical parts. I Worked on both front-end and back-end functionalities.

work.name: L’ODJ Média
work.summary: Collaborated with a team of three to develop an all-in-one platform for media content generation, including article generation, text-to-speech, and text-to-image capabilities. My tasks involved integrating Generative AI models into the platform's workflow.
highlights: Generative AI, Natural Language Processing, Data Scrapping

work.name: DeepEcho
work.summary: I collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to perform medical data analysis and develop computer vision models for analyzing fetal ultrasound images.

projects.name: LLM Based Chatbot
projects.summary: Developed a Question-Answering chatbot for Moroccan history by fine-tuning Falcon 7B Large Language Model.

projects.name: Handwritten Arabic Word Recognition
projects.summary: Build a pipeline for data preparation and model training for handwritten Arabic word recognition using CNN-LSTM based architectures.

projects.name: Face Recognition
projects.summary: Build a pipeline for data preparation and model training for Moroccan football players’ face recognition using a CNN-based architecture.

projects.name: Spoken Language Identification
projects.summary: Build pipeline for processing audio data and training a model to identify the spoken language (Arabic, English, French, Russian) within audio recordings.

projects.name: Movies Recommendation System
projects.summary: Data collection, preprocessing, and model training and evaluation for movies recommendation using KNN, KMeans and Neural Networks.

publications.name: AI + HADR Workshop @ NeurIPS’23: Morocco Solidarity Hackathon. Leveraging AI for natural disaster management Takeaways from the Moroccan earthquake, 2023.
publications.summary: In response to the 2023 6.8-magnitude earthquake in Al Haouz, Morocco, a post-disaster hackathon was organized to leverage artificial intelligence (AI) for improving disaster management strategies. This paper presents (i) a literature review, (ii) an overview of winning projects, (iii) insights on challenges such as real-time data access and interdisciplinary collaboration, and (iv) a call for community action.

awards.title: MoroccoAI - GenAI Hackathon
awards.summary: Winner - Project ”SmartFarmer” - LLMs powered chatbot for Moroccan agriculture.

awards.title: Med Innovation Tour Hackathon
awards.awarder: The Chamber of Commerce, Industry, and Services of Fès-Meknès

awards.title: Moroccan Solidarity Hackathon
awards.summary: Winner - Project proposition ”Drones for disaster mitigation”

volunteer.organization: Teens in AI - ICESCO-UEMF Women in Science
volunteer.summary: Teens in AI organized a hackathon to empower youth and introduce them to AI technologies through mini projects. I mentored several teams, explaining AI concepts and demonstrating how it can help them bring their ideas to life.
